sen.j: 久世家（くぜけ）は、村上源氏系の堂上家（新家）。
sen.e: The Kuze family was a Tosho family (new family) of the Murakami Genji line.

sen.j: 久我家19代久我敦通の次男・久世通式が元和_(日本)5年（1619年）に久我家領であった京都郊外の下久世村に所領を分与されて成立する。
sen.e: The family was established when, in 1619, a land was distributed to the Simukuze village located in the surburbs of Kyoto and owned by the Koga family, that is, when Michinori KUZE, the second son of Atumichi KOGA, the nineteenth head of the Koga family, got this land.

sen.j: 初代は久世久世通式で細川忠隆の三女福姫が正室。
sen.e: The first head of the family was Michinori KUZE and his Seishitu (legal wife) was Fukuhime, the third daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 久我家から分岐した公家諸家としては、久世家の他に中院家、六条家六条家（村上源氏）、岩倉家、千種家、東久世家、梅渓家、愛宕家、植松家の8家がある。
sen.e: The noble families branched from the Koga family include, besides Kuze family, 8 families: the Nakanoin family, Rokujyo family (Murakami Genji), the Iwakura family, the Chigusa family, the Higashikuze family, the Umetani family, the Otagi family and the Uematsu family.

sen.j: 8代目にあたる久世通煕は幕末に公武合体派として活躍し、万延元年（1860年）8月から慶応3年4月（1867年）まで（途中文久2年（1862年）9月から翌年12月を除く）にかけて議奏を務めた。
sen.e: Michihiro KUZE, the eighth head of the family, played an active role in the Kobu Gattai at the end of the Edo period and was the adressor of opinions to the Emperor between August 1860 and April 1867 (exept the period from September 1862 to December 1863).

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）に通煕の子・久世通章が子爵に叙せられる。
sen.e: In 1884, Michiaki KUZE, the child of Michihiro, was given the title of viscount.
